data_description.url: Address of the ntfy service. Modify this if you want to use a different server
data_description.verify_ssl: Enable SSL certificate verification for secure connections. Disable only if connecting to a ntfy instance using a self-signed certificate

data_description.password: Enter the password corresponding to the provided username for authentication
data_description.username: Enter the username required to authenticate with protected ntfy topics

auth.description: Depending on whether the server is configured to support access control, some topics may be read/write protected so that only users with the correct credentials can subscribe or publish to them. To publish/subscribe to protected topics, you can provide a username and password. Home Assistant will automatically generate an access token to authenticate with ntfy.
auth.name: Authentication

error.invalid_topic: Invalid topic. Only letters, numbers, underscores, or dashes allowed.
error.publish_forbidden: Publishing to this topic is forbidden

data_description.name: Set an alternative name to display instead of the topic name. This helps identify topics with complex or hard-to-read names more easily.
data_description.topic: Enter the name of the topic you want to use for notifications. Topics may not be password-protected, so choose a name that's not easy to guess.

data_description.filter_message: Include messages with content that exactly matches the specified text
data_description.filter_priority: Include messages that match any of the selected priority levels. If no priority is selected, all messages are included by default
data_description.filter_tags: Only include messages that have all selected tags
data_description.filter_title: Include messages with a title that exactly matches the specified text

filter.description: Apply filters to narrow down the messages received when Home Assistant subscribes to the topic. Filters apply only to the event entity.
filter.name: Message filters (optional)

connection_error.message: Failed to connect to ntfy service due to a connection error

delay_no_call.message: Delayed call notifications are not supported

delay_no_email.message: Delayed email notifications are not supported

entity_not_found.message: The selected ntfy entity could not be found.

entry_not_loaded.message: The selected ntfy service is currently not loaded or disabled in Home Assistant.

publish_failed_exception.message: Failed to publish notification due to a connection error

server_error.message: Failed to connect to ntfy service due to a server error: {error_msg}

timeout_error.message: Failed to connect to ntfy service due to a connection timeout

confirm.description:
The topic **{topic}** is protected and requires authentication to subscribe.

To resolve this issue, you have two options:

1. **Reconfigure the ntfy integration**
Add a username and password that has permission to access this topic.

2. **Deactivate the event entity**
This will stop Home Assistant from subscribing to the topic.
Click **Submit** to deactivate the entity.
confirm.title: Topic {topic} is protected

publish.description: Publishes a notification message to a ntfy topic

attach.description: Attach images or other files by URL.
attach.name: Attachment URL

call.description: Phone number to call and read the message out loud using text-to-speech. Requires ntfy Pro and prior phone number verification.
call.name: Phone call

click.description: URL that is opened when notification is clicked.
click.name: Click URL

delay.description: Set a delay for message delivery. Minimum delay is 10 seconds, maximum is 3 days.
delay.name: Delay delivery

email.description: Specify the address to forward the notification to, for example mail@example.com
email.name: Forward to email

icon.description: Include an icon that will appear next to the text of the notification. Only JPEG and PNG images are supported.
icon.name: Icon URL

markdown.description: Enable Markdown formatting for the message body. See the Markdown guide for syntax details: {markdown_guide_url}.
markdown.name: Format as Markdown

priority.description: All messages have a priority that defines how urgently your phone notifies you, depending on the configured vibration patterns, notification sounds, and visibility in the notification drawer or pop-over.
priority.name: Message priority

tags.description: Add tags or emojis to the notification. Emojis (using shortcodes like smile) will appear in the notification title or message. Other tags will be displayed below the notification content.
tags.name: Tags/Emojis
